Itâ€™s a common misconception that pre-loved goods are worn-out or damaged. However, my personal experience has been quite the opposite.

Iâ€™ve delved into local charity shops, scoured platforms like Vinted, eBay, and Marketplace, and to my delight, stumbled upon items that were not just in great shape but also brand new. From toys to unique gifts, these places are like a goldmine waiting to be explored.

I encourage you to give them a chance â€“ you might be pleasantly surprised at what youâ€™ll find! Imagine stumbling upon that perfect gift or that one-of-a-kind item youâ€™ve been seeking, all while reducing your environmental impact, not to mention the absolute bargains. Itâ€™s a win-win-win situation! So, join me in embracing sustainable shopping and discovering treasures that even Santa himself would approve of. ğŸŒŸğŸ

AD* Ebay x Love Island launch lunch ğŸ’–

(*lunch paid for by Ebay)

It was such a pleasure to be invited to lunch with @ebay_uk last week for a first look at the preloved clothes heading into the Love Island villa for the second time.

The winter season aired last night and I was looking out for the four main wardrobe trends put together by Ebayâ€™s preloved stylist, @amybannermanstylist , which we got to see during the lunch: Tutti Frutti (think dopamine dressing), Business V Party (tailoring meets glamour), Heavy Metal (leather jackets, studs and metallic colours) and Dressed-up Denim.

The success of last seasonâ€™s preloved partnership was reflected in the number of people that searched for preloved clothing on Ebay: a 1600% increase from May-November 2022, based on Ebayâ€™s search data. The scope of preloved clothes has expanded this season, with Ebay featuring for the first time its â€œimperfectsâ€ range of high street and luxury products and a selection of trainers that form part of Ebayâ€™s designer authenticity guarantee programme. Ebay will even be re-using some clothes featured in the last season, a fun way to spot some previous iconic outfits as well as reinforcing rewearing. We also found out that swimwear will be sourced primarily from small and sustainable brands.

During the lunch we heard more about the partnership between Love Island and Ebay, the way in which clothes are selected, and an insight into fashion psychology with @shakailaelise .
Â 
The main takeaway for me was seeing that this partnership wasnâ€™t just a one off and Iâ€™d be keen to see the momentum continue. Iâ€™d like to see more contestants forming partnerships with sustainable brands off the back of this show, Tasha Ghouri last series becoming the first Preloved Ambassador for eBay, more references to preloved fashion throughout the show (maybe a preloved styling challenge for contestants?) and more shows generally adopting preloved, upcycled and repaired fashion and homewares as the norm.

Thanks to @easypeasysustainability for the first photo ğŸ“·

Can you see Neurodivergence? 

Well the kids at school certainly seemed to. Some teachers & bosses who bullied me along the way too. People who have tried to what seems like â€˜take me down a peg or twoâ€™ for my daring to be different knew. I think some people think Iâ€™m taking the piss when I donâ€™t get it. Or ask questions. Which I do a lot and they see something. 

Iâ€™m clumsy, you could see it in how I walked before that became more impaired, I have sensory motor tics that are a big hand flap that end in a clap. There is no hiding that. Iâ€™m very light & noise sensitive and will react. Often & loudly about it. I get overwhelmed in social situations and would often get over emotional. Everyone could see that. Sometimes Iâ€™ll talk about something i dont understand on a loop, I talk out loud to process how I feel and sometimes I get into a sheer panic over something that others just wonâ€™t understand or how overwhelming that can feel. 

I stim and I wasnâ€™t aware I did that. I will talk at you about whatever Iâ€™m most interested in because I want you to feel as excited, happy, curious & joyful about it as I do. 

I always need a plan. I always need to know whatâ€™s happening next and Iâ€™ll often ask others what might happen in a situation Iâ€™ve never been in before so I can prepare for it. I follow a routine. I donâ€™t do well with change and can get flustered and sometimes even irrationally angry when it occurs. And I canâ€™t cope with waiting. 

Tomorrow is the 6 week mark of my autism assessment. They told me theyâ€™d contact me in 5-6 weeks to arrange going over the results. So now every email, text or alert on my phone is sending me into a hyper vigilance, excitement sweats then disappointment when itâ€™s not what Iâ€™m waiting for it to beğŸ˜¬

Image description: rue power dressing to pass the time in a new beloved 70s denim Levi cowboy hat, secondhand denim & diamantÃ© crop top with shredded white tasseled trousers, a white blazer and silver metallic boots with zig zag heels. 

#neurodivergence  #neurodivergent #autismacceptance #cowboyfashion #visabilityfordisability #babewithamobilityaid #disabilityawareness #dopaminedressing #autisticwomen #secondhandfashion #vintagefashion

I finally found Autistic friendly toothpaste & itâ€™s a huge thing for me. 

Iâ€™ve struggled to brush my teeth since childhood. Why is it always mint. Itâ€™s chalky, gritty & makes me gag. Iâ€™ve tried every kind that isnâ€™t traditional & all gross. But this is IT. I swear! Gel based, really nice flavours by @hismile Iâ€™m in love with pistachio and Iâ€™m so fricking happy I wanted everyone else who struggles with toothpaste to know! Please tell every autistic person you know, they will thank you â˜ºï¸

musicInfo/song_name: I See It, I Like It, I Want It

caption:
Ten years on Instagram, I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve changed much ğŸ˜œ

Age 35 to 45 had me making bolder choices and dressing for the pure joy of it. I donâ€™t care what suits me, flatters me or goes together. I donâ€™t care what the fashion rules are. If it catches my eye and I love it, Iâ€™m wearing it. 

Although truth as always, these are my dress up days where I do this for my own fun, regulation and because I like to catalogue my clothing. Iâ€™m at home all the time chronically ill and 99.9% of the time I wear a grotty old tee and my big beige pants. But I make time to do this as my specialist interest, to retain my sense of identity and to express myself.

Introductions - come get to know me some 

Iâ€™m Rue, a middle aged wee wifie (Iâ€™m only 5 5â€ but everyone thinks Iâ€™m taller) living up a hillside in Wales. 

Iâ€™m autistic & disabled and my specialist interest is fashion. In particular vintage. But I donâ€™t wear it in a conventional way. I mix vintage with lots of secondhand pieces. And I love guessing the dates of clothing. 

I advocate for #visabilityfordisability in fashion as we make up to 20% of populations and intersect with every minority but are hugely underrepresented in all aspects of life. We need to see disabled people represented on catwalks, fashion shoots, social media pr campaigns, advertising & tv and film and to change the perception of disability as being something to fear and illuminate instead the  #disabledjoy #autisticjoy 

Iâ€™m also #chronicallyill and spent 99% of my time at home living in my own wee happy bubble. I plan and pace my time so once a week I can play dress up and indulge in what brings me happiness. The rest of the week Iâ€™m in a grotty t shirt & pants for comfort ğŸ˜

Todayâ€™s outfit is inspired by old period movies like Howardâ€™s end from the 90s that drew heavily from the 70s fashion era for costumes. 

70s Celadon hat, modern pink 70s style glasses, secondhand 70s inspired blouse in a Victorian style, 30s celadon tap pants, mid century yellow plastic necklace and secondhand 90s style yellow platform shoes and my new beloved pink fairytale walking stick from @neowalksticks because mobility aids are epic ğŸŒ¸

Lipgloss doesn't count on no makeup Monday, does it?

Charity shops always â™¥ï¸ 

Going for a nosey today let's see what we find!!

Here are 5 places where Iâ€™ll be shopping smart this Black Friday. Swipe to see pieces Iâ€™ve bought from them before!

Donâ€™t worry though, these are all secondhand! I love filling up virtual shopping baskets and watching my favourite items from these brands, so this week is an opportunity to save some money whilst buying the things that I need.

ğŸ–¤ @thrift_plus_uk - Thrift+ wants to encourage people to only shop what they really love - so, theyâ€™ve priced dropped 40k+ items by up to 70% that have been favourited by thrifters. 

ğŸ–¤ @reliked - One of my fav thrifting website, Reliked is having huge discounts this Black Friday on their app. Tip: turn on notifications because the best stuff sells really fast.

ğŸ–¤ @lespetitschampingnons - you need to know this sweet kids wear company! Les Petit Champignons is doing a 20% off sitewide plus a PCRF charity donation from every order for Black Friday.

ğŸ–¤ @hirestreetuk - Their everyday value is already better then brands on Black Friday and there will be giveaways + the chance to win your order back!

ğŸ–¤ @ebay_uk - eBay is already running up to 70% off secondhand fashion. I have a trench coat on my wish list that I planning on taking home.

 #SustainableChoices #BoycottBlackFriday #MindfulConsumption #BlackFriday

For the girlies who say that sustainable fashion is too expensive ğŸ¤ª We can absolutely still love fashion while being conscious about the environment at the same time - even if youâ€™re on a budget.

One of the biggest myths I often hear about sustainable fashion is that it is too expensive but this is only true if we buy as much as weâ€™re used to from fast fashion. The golden rule of sustainability is NOT TO BUY! Wear what you already own, swap and buy secondhand first and foremost. 

Trust me, youâ€™ll soon realise that you have a much bigger budget than youâ€™ve imagined to invest in ethically made clothes ğŸ’š

The flea markets in Paris have become sort of a staple of my weekends. Quite often I donâ€™t have anything Iâ€™m looking for and donâ€™t end up bringing anything home, but wandering through the seemingly endless rows of tables filled with antiques, trinkets, and vintage, all unique and full of history, is my idea of a perfect afternoon. Something about those items that have lived multiple lives and survived generations is just so fascinating to me, and I have to say, Iâ€™m especially spoiled for the selection at the markets here. 

What other cities do you think have incredible flea markets? Let me know, I need to visit them all!

Eloise at Christmastime, except itâ€™s me and in Paris âœ¨ 

Eloise at Christmastime was always one of my favourite holiday books when I was young. My dad would sometimes take me to the bookshop after the Santa Clause Parade in Toronto to pick a new holiday book and this is one I continued to come back to year after year. I could always relate to Eloiseâ€™s level of enthusiasm for the holidays and her need to spread festive cheer, and found the illustrations just so fun and whimsical. It wasnâ€™t until I was in high school that I realized there was a film adaptation as well, and quickly added it to my holiday movie list. Did you have a favourite holiday book growing up too?

One of my own little traditions every year is to make a â€œChristmas fettucineâ€ Ã  la Iris Simpkins to eat while I watch it and inevitably swoon over the male leads. Richelle searches for sea shells on the Salthill sea shore ğŸš

I stayed a little outside the city centre when I was in Galway, and besides the fact that it ended up being a really lovely place, it was so nice to be so close to the ocean. My apartments in Toronto always ended up being close to the lake, and I loved going for walks by the quays and waterfront. I often catch myself gravitating towards bodies of water, whether itâ€™s walks along the Seine or the river at my parents house. The smell of the saltwater in the wind, sea shells littered along the beach, and squawks of the sea gulls made staying in Salthill such a joy for me. 

Wearing my trusty thrifted trench coat, Monoprix scarf, and @sezane cardigan, jeans and loafers (kindly gifted).

The bomber jacket, or flight jacket for the purists, is a staple of men's fashion. My first memories of it go back to the '90s. Everyone at school was wearing one. The lucky ones had @schottnyc_europe jackets, while I got a second-hand COMPLICES. But I was still happy. 

It fell out of style for a while but made a comeback, thanks in part to Kanye West in the early 2010s! Once worn slim, it's been revived in oversized fits over the last few years. 

This one is a @vinted find, bought for just a few euros. The outfit is inspired by @xxjmitch for his collaboration with @madewellmens . And as for the video, @derrick_b_smith  that's where I drew my inspiration!

All you need is... Not love but shortsleeve shirt for this summer ! Oversize, slim, cuban collar, crochet, coton, silk or whatever it is, it's a summer must have. 
Few years ago, I was against this type of shirts. 
But Time has changed, and so has fashion. You Can look good in a short sleeved shirt without looking like a 50 year old accountant (No offense haha). 

Mine is a birthday gift, from @elementbrand with cuban collar and birds on it. I love it !
Wear with a classic vintage Brown pants from @vinted
A pair of @converse Chuck Taylor 70 low 

What do you think about it ?

The NFL jersey outfit when it's really hot outside is not the best Idea even if I really like the result.  the synthetic fabric of the top not your best friend ğŸ˜…
More seriously, I really love this kind of NFL, NBA or NHL jersey, it reminds me the 2000s hip hop Era, oversized jersey, matching New Era cap with a baggy and a pair of air force one or Timberland. Do you remember this Era ? Were you born in 2000 ? 

Cap : #vintagecap Reebok found on #vinted

Question of the day : Do you wear short ? 
I've discovered that some m'en never wear short ! It's pretty surprising but I can understand. It's not really easy to look dapper in short but I'm sure some of you Can. As you can sÃ©e, I'm not in that classy dandy dapper mood. My influence are really streetwear. The comfier outfit for me it's an oversize t-shirt, a baggy short and a really cool pair of sneakers of course !
But sometimes I want to upgrade my style so I decided to wear my crochet short (favorite short of the moment btw) with a large shortsleeve shirt, cuban collar that I cropped a little bit. 
On my feet, some #adidasrivalry.
I'm more info Nike (as you Can see in the background) but adidas classic are Always good ! 

Shirt : #thrifted on #vinted
Short : #primark
Shoes : Adidas Rivalry low from @zalando 
.

Do I need to remind you that I'm addicted to #thrifting , #secondhand  clothes and I spend a lot of  money on #Vinted (in fact, not that much !). 
I Always have target in mind and I won't stop digging until I found the perfect treasure. It means : good product at a good Price ! I used to look for sneakers, but my sneakers closet is full now, so it's time to find some jacket for the autumn !

This is one is an all black varsity Jacket, with real leather sleeves, oversized fitting (it's a size XL). I sew a patch on it because I wanted to cover the brand. 
I only paid 15â‚¬ for it (around 15$ for my american Friends !). The seller was @barpullvintage

Can't wait to Wear it ! 

For this style :

Jacket : #varsityjacket found on  @vinted
T-shirt : basic #h&M t-shirt 
Pants : suit pants also from Vinted
Shoes : #airjordan3 white cement reimagined. I'm in love with these shoes. I could Wear it every day !

What's the most important piece of your closet ? For me, 2 things :
First : Hat : I Always Wear something on my head, it Can be a beanie, a hat, or a vintage snapback cap from my collection. 
Second : sneakers or shoes in general ! As you see on my feed or story, I'm a Big shoes lover, I can wear one different pair of shoes per day during 5 months. I know I'm not the only one here with this sickness ! 

This outfit is really simple, plain overshirt black t-shirt with a tennis light Yellow short. The cherry on the cake is the cap and my Jordan 3 fire red !

Hat : vintage 49ers retro cap found on @vinted
T-shirt : simple t-shirt from #primark
Short : also from #vinted
Sneakers : #jordan3firered

caption:
Paris photo dump. We're back in Paris for few days. We moved 6 years ago to Bordeaux, it was the best choice of our life but it's a pleasure to be back. Only for few days and do tourist thing like fly boat, Eiffel tower with our daughter ! 

Of course I have to be fresh and fly for the fashion capital ! As you Can see, my Venezia vintage cap is the perfect choice ! 

This is a simple classic streetwear outfits for men when it's hot in summer but not too much. 

Hat : vintage snapback from @vinted
Shirt : a shortsleeve shirt, silk effect. It's a 3XL size for the perfect oversize effect. Also from #vinted
Pants : grandpa pants from thrift @guerrisolfrance 
Shoes : my favorite #newbalance990v3 Marble head color by @teddysantis

Bandana or not bandana ? That's the question for this Sunday !
For me it's yes, go bandana or any scarf for a cool men summer outfit. 
A basic regular fit t-shirt, a nice pair of black jeans, a cool retro cap and of course a running dad shoes from @sauconyoriginals

Classic striped shirt with a tank top and a short, what do you think about it ?

I only have one pair of sneakers, my #newbalance990v3 but fortunately I Can wear it with different style. Baggy pants, casual pants, short, jeans and more. Every corner of Dublin tells a story, and I was eager to listen to them all. 

â€”â€”

One project from elementary school that often stands out in my memory is one that was assigned about the country of our heritage, its culture, and its traditions, that concluded in a big showcase in the gymnasium. I remember asking my mom where we came from and which country I should do, since my heritage is quite a mix and many generations Canadian. I learned her side has strong roots in Ireland and Scotland, so I decided to pick Ireland as the focus of my project. I still remember how intrigued I was by all that I was learning about the country in my research, and proudly sharing it all with my classmates in that gymnasium.

Iâ€™ve clearly felt strong ties to other countries as well having recently moved to France, but Ireland has always been high up on the travel bucket list, and ever since that one project Iâ€™ve felt most connected to my Irish ancestry out of all our other countries of origin. 

Although Iâ€™ve barely scratched the surface of the emerald isle on this trip, being able to finally visit the country where my ancestors once lived and see it all in person was such an unforgettable experience, and I already know Iâ€™ll definitely be back again soon. 

.
.
.

caption:
Safe to say this autumn has been a little different than usual: settling into life in a new country, kicking off the season in Spain rather than with Canadian Thanksgiving, and hunting for fall foliage in polished parks rather than cottage country, but Iâ€™m starting to embrace the fact that change, in life just as in the seasons, is inevitable, and â€œdifferentâ€ can be just as, and sometimes even more, wonderful as the usual. I tend to get very stuck in my ways, routines, and made-up traditions, but all this change is the push I needed to see things from a different perspective, shake things up a little, and appreciate my new ways of being just as they are.

One of the things preparing for my move thatâ€™s been quite difficult for me is having to pack away the little world Iâ€™ve created in my apartment. As exciting as it is to start fresh and experience something completely new, I canâ€™t help but feel a little sentimental about all the things Iâ€™ve collected and thoughtfully placed to create my home. From the knick-knacks my grandma gave me when I was little to the vintage candelabra I found on a trip, thereâ€™s little pieces of my life scattered throughout my apartment. I just have to remember that there are more treasures and memories to find along the way, and as long as I have pictures, and music, and everything beautiful, I can make my own little world wherever I choose it to be. 

.
.
.
.
.

caption:
This Saturday I had the pleasure of visiting @cruickstonpark - a family owned private estate with luxury guesthouses and a charming farm less than 2 hours from the city. 

We did yoga in the gardens, made some new friends on the farm, enjoyed brunch in the cottage, and I even got to try milking a goat (if it werenâ€™t for the watchful moms I definitely wouldâ€™ve tried to take one of the babies home with meâ€¦ I mean can you blame me?)

Itâ€™s such an enchanting spot for a weekend getaway and the entire morning felt like Iâ€™d stepped right into a fairytale in the English countryside. 

Check out their page to stay updated on upcoming events and to learn more about booking a guesthouse for your own fairytale getaway ğŸ¤ (hosted/pr)

Vous pouvez vous cogner Ã  la vie. Si vous laissez passer cette chance, alors avec le temps, câ€™est votre cÅ“ur qui va devenir aussi sec et cassant que mon squelette.â€

I recently had the pleasure of seeing the 4K restoration of AmÃ©lie in the theatre, and although Iâ€™ve seen it countless times, seeing it on the big screen like that reignited my love of the film and the joy it brings me. Iâ€™m always talking about running off to Paris, but after watching the restored film I really craved a long walk through Montmartreâ€™s winding streets and a good crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e. Seeing your favourite movie on the big screen is just such a special experience, and you can bet I listened to the soundtrack all the way home. Is there a special film youâ€™d love to see in theatres?

And thank you to @vicfilippini for finding out about the showing and bringing me along! ğŸ’Œ

If the weather forecast for the rest of the month in Toronto goes as predicted, itâ€™s looking like we may have had the last of the winter chill for the season. It does feel strange that weâ€™ve had such a mild winter compared to previous years and much less snow than usual, but I canâ€™t help but look on the bright side and enjoy the warmer temperatures and sunshine making an appearance over the last week or so.  I do have a few winter pieces I wish Iâ€™d gotten more wear out of this year, but Iâ€™ll happily swap my heavy coats and boots for flats and bare legs early this year. While the warmer weather is probably a cause for concern in the grander scheme of things, Iâ€™ll still take it over a slushy, wet winter any day. 

.

.

Only four days into the new year, and yet somehow it both feels like the holidays were weeks ago as well as just yesterday. Itâ€™s easy to get caught up in trying to conquer your goals and resolutions right away to keep the momentum going, but remember that you have another 361 days to go. You donâ€™t need to have a brand new routine already mastered, or have made a bunch of big changes in the last few days. Itâ€™s all about the small steps you take everyday that will lead you to where you want to go, and there doesnâ€™t have to be a firm deadline for that. Letâ€™s be a bit gentler with ourselves this year, shall we?

Figured it was a good time for a little re-introduction - hereâ€™s a bit about me âœ¨ 

Hi, Iâ€™m Richelle. 

I live in downtown Toronto with my senior dog Lulu. Iâ€™m a Gemini/Cancer cusp sun, Libra rising and Scorpio moon. 

Iâ€™ve studied fashion design, business and digital communications, and developed an infatuation for the fashion world at a very young age. 

I have a love of Parisian style, vintage, and about 75% of my wardrobe is thrifted. I would consider myself a francophile, and I believe in romanticizing the everyday. 

Iâ€™ve been sharing my style online in various mediums for longer than I can remember, and I canâ€™t picture my life without documenting my silly little outfits and creative ideas.

caption:
Well, thereâ€™s no more denying it - winter has arrived in Toronto. Iâ€™ve been trying to stay in a delulu itâ€™s-still-autumn-and-not-that-cold-out mindset the last few weeks, but the temperatures have dropped, the first few snowflakes of the year have started floating past my window, and my winter coats are back hanging in my closet. The arrival of the long Ontario winter has always been a bit of a struggle despite living here my whole life, but I do love the sparkle that comes with the holiday season, and am definitely looking forward to getting into cozy, festive mode now that we have the weather to match. 

What about you - are you still soaking in the last days of autumn, or are you already full festive? 

.
.
. 
.
.

With my love of trench coats, itâ€™s only natural Lulu should have one too, right? 

Thereâ€™s just something about a dog in a coat that always puts a smile on my face, and it makes my day when I notice a passerby smiling or a little kid pointing, knowing I can share that little moment of joy with others. 

My trench coat is thrifted, Luluâ€™s is from H&M years ago, my dress is from @uniqlocanada, my bag is from @beara_beara and my shoes are old @colehaan.

I donâ€™t know about you, but as much as Iâ€™m looking forward to autumn, the transition of seasons has really been throwing me for a loop this time around. I know we have a few weeks until we set the clocks back again, but Iâ€™ve realized that the sun setting earlier and rising later is already affecting my routine. Iâ€™m noticing myself eating dinner way too late, and hitting snooze far too much in the morning. Over the summer I get so used to those long days of sun, and my brain still wants to believe the sun sets late, not around 7 PM like it has been lately. While I welcome the change of seasons and am looking forward to the cozy months, it seems I might need more time to adjust to the changing in daylight hours than I might have thought... ğŸ‚ğŸ•°ï¸

Something that stuck with me over the last month was some advice that was given to me at a farmerâ€™s market tarot reading. A card simply titled â€œplayâ€ came out in my reading, and it was interpreted as needing more non-judgemental play in my life - doing things just for the enjoyment of them. This really resonated with me as someone who tends to focus on having to be good at something or turn it into something productive, over just taking pleasure in the things I enjoy. Since that reading Iâ€™ve been trying to be mindful about incorporating more â€œplayâ€ into my life and focusing on joy rather than overanalyzing everything. 

I was inspired by some photos I came across on Pinterest while I was up north, and thought it would be fun to try recreating something similar. The end result wasnâ€™t exactly what I had envisioned, but I still love how they turned out, and most importantly, I had fun. 

.
.
.
.
